Name: Tranquility Base: SovietMoon
Description:
SovietMoon is an AI game system that expands Tranquility Base into an exciting and true Soviet vs. US Space Race.

SovietMoon pits the US players against the Soviets as each try to achieve the first manned lunar landing. The game can be considered semi-cooperative but it is still a race to be the first to land on the moon. The SovietMoon deck provides an AI opponent that is challenging and difficult to beat. Players may find opportunities to cooperate for overall success, but superior game-play and completion of multiple missions in a single turn will benefit players the most.

—description from the publisher

Name: Quick Pickle
Description:
This fast-paced, family-friendly card game has you tossing toppings and collecting pickles.

Flip a card and be quick to react to keep your pickle stash intact.  Take too long and you'll be passing pickles to your opponents.  The player with the most pickles at the end of the game wins!

—description from the publisher

Name: The Hydrologically-Challenged Haunted Hayride at Hank's Hen Hatchery
Description:
Hank’s Hen Hatchery in known for the best fresh eggs in the county! But in the fall, the thing that Hank is known for is his haunted hayride. But this year…YOU ARE IN CHARGE of creating it! Of course, when you took the job, no one warned you about the upcoming monsoon season…

You will need to purchase and place various haunted hayride attractions on Hank’s property. Then you will draw the path for the tractor to pull guests around in the hopes of delightfully scaring them. Unfortunately, while you are planning your tractor route, the yearly monsoon hits, and you will need to contend with ever-growing flooded areas of the farm. Not only that, but you have to contend with Marcie’s Teenage Troublemakers on the night of the hayride, who love to egg the guests as they ride by.

Haunted Hayride is a roll-and-write where all you need is a few dice and pencil. In stage one, you are placing your attractions on the map. In stage two, you are drawing a path that you will take your guests on to visit those attractions while your property slowly floods.

—description from the designer

Name: DropMix: Mighty Morphin Power Rangers – Main Title Theme Promo Card
Description:
An exclusive promo card released as a giveaway to the attendees of Power Morphicon 2018 in Anaheim, CA.

This is an additional wild card (can be played on any color slot) and plays the song Go Go Power Rangers (Redux) by Ron Wasserman.  The song is from the album Power Rangers Redux.

The card features art from Dan Mora - from the comic "Saban's Go Go Power Rangers Volume 1".

Icons for the card are as follows:

Yellow (Lead): Vocals
Red (Loop): Guitar
Blue (Beat): Drums
Green (Bass): Guitar

The expansion icon displays a DM logo in the lower right corner of the card with a "4" below it.

Name: 5 Second Rule: South African Edition
Description: It should be easy to name 3 South African foods starting with “B” - but can you do it under the pressure of 5 seconds twisting down, and with the other players staring at you, waiting for you to get flustered? Time is not on your side, so just say what comes to mind and risk ridiculous answers slipping out as time twirls down on the unique twisted timer! It’s all in good fun with this fast-paced game where you have to “Just Spit It Out!”

Name: Tark Pere Taskus
Description:
Various cards from Tark Mees Taskus,Tark Mees Taskus 2,Tark Laps Taskus ,Tark Naine Taskus and some unreleased cards.

There is letter in one side of the card and theme (mammals, cities, occupations, games etc.), image or mini word games in another side of the card. Turn around top card and be the first to solve the objective and you get the card as a point. If nobody can´t say anything or there is a tie the card is kept for the next round.
If the deck runs out the player with the most points is the winner.

Name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Andrea, Prison Sniper Booster
Description:
This booster pack contains 3 unique, collectible miniatures allowing you to add Andrea, Billy & Ben to your games, along with an extra armored Walker to bulk out your horde.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War

Name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Morgan, Distraught Father Booster
Description:
This booster pack contains 3 unique, collectible miniatures allowing you to add Morgan and Eugene to your games, along with an extra Walker to bulk out your horde.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War

Name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Alice Booster
Description:
This booster pack contains 3 unique, collectible miniatures allowing you to add Alice and Bob to your games, along with an extra Walker to bulk out your herd.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War

Name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – The Governor Booster
Description:
This booster pack contains 3 unique, collectible miniatures allowing you to add The Governor and Gloria to your games, along with an extra Walker to bulk out your herd.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War

Name: Game of Kingdoms
Description:
Game of Kingdoms is a game where there is no winner, only a loser! A card game of attacking and defending, involving some luck but mostly strategy. The object of the game is to get rid of your cards before your enemies. You start with six cards and take turns attacking and defending. Higher card beats lower card and trumps beat them all- unless it's a higher trump... Will you be lucky and draw all the trumps or will you have to be strategic and make the best of every hand!? You'll be up, you'll be down - the tide may turn many times. Attack wisely and you'll bury your opponent, defend poorly and you'll get stuck with both hands full of cards.

—description from the designer

Name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Rick, Disfigured but Determined Booster
Description:
This booster pack contains 3 unique, collectible miniatures allowing you to add Rick and Curtis to your games, along with an extra Walker to bulk out your herd.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War

Name: Scubi Sea Saga: The Logic Game for All Ages
Description:
Immerse yourself in the colorful underwater world of Scubi the seahorse in Scubi Sea Saga: The Logic Game for All Ages.

Accompany Scubi through the magical coral reef and rescue his friends from the dangers of the deep sea. Collect valuable points before the Great White Shark goes hunting. What are you waiting for? On your marks, get set, dive!

The app guides the gameplay and provides help when you need it, along with new features and more tactical options.

•••

Tauche ein in die bunte Unterwasserwelt von Scubi dem Seepferdchen. Begleite Scubi durch das zauberhafte Korallenriff und rette so viele seinerFreunde vor den Gefahren des tiefen Meeres.Sammle wertvolle Punkte bevor der große weiße Hai auf Jagd geht. Worauf wartest du noch? Auf die Plätze, fertig, abtauchen!

Mehr Spielspaß: Auspacken und sofort losspielen! Die App unterstützt genau dann wenn Fragen auftauchen.

Mehr Dynamik: Zusätzliche Funktionen in der App sorgen für mehr taktische Möglichkeiten.

Mehr Action: Die App steuert den Spielablauf und sorgt für noch mehr Action beim Spielen.

Mehr Abwechslung: App-Updates sorgen für neue Features und zusätzliche Spielvarianten.

Name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Maggie and Glenn on Horseback Booster
Description:
This booster pack contains 2 unique, resin, collectible miniatures, allowing you to add Maggie and Glenn on horseback to your games.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War

Name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Abraham Booster
Description:
This booster pack contains 2 unique, collectible miniatures allowing you to add Abraham and Jud to your games.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War

Name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Father Gabriel Booster
Description:
This booster pack contains 2 unique, collectible miniatures allowing you to add Father Gabriel and Carl Grimes to your games.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War

Name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Rosita & Eugene Booster
Description:
This booster pack contains 2 unique, collectible miniatures allowing you to add Rosita and Eugene to your games.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War

Name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Fear the Hunters Expansion
Description:
The Fear the Hunters Expansion for The Walking Dead: All Out War Miniatures Game recreates the ongoing struggle of the survivors as they encounter their worse foe yet - the cannibalistic hunters! The set also includes new characters, equipment, supplies, and events to expand your regular games. There is also a new set of expanded Campaign rules, cards, and a Campaign Map. This will allow you to create a series of interlinked games in which the Survivors occupy areas such as hospitals, ammo stores and shopping malls to help them survive.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War

Name: Horizon Zero Dawn: The Board Game – Frozen Wilds
Description:
The Frozen Wilds expansion is set in the icy north where the Banuk make their home, including unique tiles, equipment, and tracking cards to represent this wintery land. This expansion allows players to play as two proud new hunters from the Banuk tribe, and includes their hunter decks and upgrade cards. Also included are highly detailed models for the Scorcher and Frostclaw (2 of each), and rules for encountering them in your games, as well as rules and cards for introducing daemonic machines.

—description from the publisher

Name: Horizon Zero Dawn: The Board Game – Thunderjaw
Description:
The Thunderjaw expansion allows players to upgrade their quarry to the next level, and test themselves against this terrifying foe. It includes a highly detailed model for this iconic adversary, as well as rules, cards, and special tiles for the encounter.

—description from the publisher

Name: Horizon Zero Dawn: The Board Game – Rockbreaker
Description:
The Rockbreaker expansion allows players to upgrade their quarry to the next level, and test themselves against this challenging enemy. It includes a highly detailed model for this enigmatic machine, as well as rules, cards, and special tiles for the encounter.

—description from the publisher

Name: Horizon Zero Dawn: The Board Game – Stormbird
Description:
The Stormbird expansion allows players to upgrade their quarry to the next level, and test themselves against this daunting creature. It includes a highly detailed model for this incredible machine, as well as rules, cards, and special tiles for the encounter.

—description from the publisher

Name: Horizon Zero Dawn: The Board Game – Fireclaw
Description:
The Fireclaw expansion allows players to upgrade their quarry to the next level, and test themselves against this formidable new machine. It includes a highly detailed model for HEPHAESTUS’ most powerful creation, as well as rules, cards, and special tiles for the encounter.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Made to Suffer Expansion
Description:
The Made to Suffer Expansion for The Walking Dead: All Out War Miniatures Game recreates the ongoing struggle of the survivors and Rick’s ill-fated encounter with the tyrannical boss of Woodbury – the Governor! The set also includes new characters, equipment, supplies, events and scenery to expand your regular games.

It also contains a printed play-mat with detailed town interiors, rules for fighting inside, and expanded rules for larger games and allied forces!

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War

Name: Four Big Strata
Description:
In ancient China, there were four major strata: the sergeant, the peasants, the workers and the merchants. They were the cornerstones of the whole society, created the prosperity of the society and promoted the process of the history of Chinese civilization.

Four Big Strata is based on these four classes as the basis of the core, derived from the mild strategy to develop the game, players in the game to operate their own civilization, to balanced and prudent development and maintenance of their own four classes, because in the end of the game, the lowest class score, will be the score of the player.

Players get a card each round by bidding, and the card is placed in one of the four strata, producing the effect of this stratum, such as farmers produce food, merchants produce money, sergeants property rights, workers provide technology bonuses, which are then maintained and paid, consuming the corresponding food and money. At the end of the game, the score is decided by the total score of the lowest class, so we must maintain their civilized needs in the game process on the one hand, on the other hand, try to balance the development.

Name: Champions of Hara: Chaos On Hara
Description:
Shadows have fallen over Hara; the bastion of beauty and free expression has become warped by powers of its own design. With so many strong-willed souls all creating in one space, it was only a matter of time before the edges started to crack. Now the evil serpent, Doubt, is spreading, corrupting paradise from within. Dark Rifts are emerging to poison the land around them, and the Kensei, Hara's stewards, are becoming increasingly demanding of the poor souls that have been brought to this world.

Chaos On Hara, an expansion to Champions Of Hara, adds four new playable characters, along with the components necessary for five and six player games. Go deeper into the world of Hara with new Monsters and Event cards for each World, and face off against four vicious new Corrupted foes. This expansion also contains sixteen new Scenarios for you to fight your way through, including four new solo Scenarios and four ultra-hard "Challenges From The Void".

Name: Thinkamabob
Description:
Thinkamabob the game that tickles every inch of your brain

What You're Playin' For: Use the Thinkamabobs + your big brain to complete challenges and earn points as you use the five areas of brain function: critical thinking, coordination, memory, word skill, and visual perception.  Use points to move pawns around the track and into your Winner's Row!

However, if you can't complete a challenge, be prepared to be judged, because as a group, all your competitors will decide your score! Just remember, what goes around comes around... (We really could have called this game "Think-karma-bob.")

—description from the publisher

Name: Sir Holland: A Fuga da Torre
Description:
On a dark night, the Kingdom of Nhekos met the wrath of The Dark Wizard and the Black Night, Sir Holland's greatest enemies. All of the kingdom's subjects have been captured and kept in a tower, a dreadful and threatening place.

However, some bold heroes are not to be so easily defeated. By finding a breach in the dungeon, they will try to escape from the tower...by climbing it! They will need all their skills to dodge the villains and try to get to the top as quickly as possible. Such a journey is never made without setbacks, and in Sir Holland: A Fuga da Torre ("Escape the Tower') our heroes can accidentally put their friends in danger — and the villains will have an eye on every step they take!

Name: Super Me!
Description:
It's Easy To Play!

     Flip over an Emergency! card
     Make a Super Me! match
     Be a Superhero


This game was developed to help kids recognize opportunities to help others.  Anyone can be a superhero by helping!

—description from the publisher

Name: Monkey, May I?
Description:
Don't get caught monkeying around!  This game is easy to play!


     Flip over an action card
     Make a good choice
     Collect Monkey Money


This game was developed to help kids learn to make good choices.

Skill checklist:
Self-Awareness
Self-Control
Making Good Choices

—description from the designer

Name: Munchkin Quest: Big Box
Description:
Kill the monster, grab the treasure, stab your buddy. That's what it's all about. Now, Munchkin has been transformed into a board game...

In Munchkin Quest, you can co-operate with the whole group, adventure with a partner, or strike out on your own. You don't know what's behind a door until you open it...then another tile is added to the dungeon. Battle monsters for power and treasure, or send them after your friends. Reach Level 10, then get out alive if you can!

Munchkin Quest: Big Box includes the original base game as well as Munchkin Quest 2: Looking for Trouble and Munchkin Quest: Portal Kombat.
Families: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

Name: Prinsessans bal
Description:
The box folds out to form the garden board, with a castle backdrop added on one side. Each player/princess moves along their own garden path towards the castle, turning up helping or hindering tokens as they go. Some rolls make you obtain or relinquish the game's one bracelet. You win by reaching the end of your path and also holding the bracelet.

Not to be confused with a different princess-themed set collection game of the same name published earlier by Alga.

—user summary

Name: Soberano
Description:
Soberano ("Sovereign") is a card game that simulates a Renaissance court power struggle. The cards represent the characters, alliances, and powers. It's a fast-paced deck-building game with some twists.

•••

Soberano é um jogo de cartas que simula a disputa pelo poder em uma corte renascentista. As cartas representam os personagens, suas alianças e seus poderes.

Descrição    “O Rei está morto.”

Sem herdeiros aparentes e com todas as famílias nobres do reino alegando pretensão ao trono, o futuro parece incerto. Mas, de fato, apenas os Áquila e os Leone tem poder e influência para validar sua reivindicação e eles concordam em apenas uma coisa: preferem uma guerra a aceitar seus rivais no trono.

Você sabia disso. Você se preparou para isso. Infiltrou aliados leais a você nas duas famílias e agora chegou a hora de agir. Afinal, a coroa ficará melhor na sua cabeça.

“Vida longa ao Soberano.”

O Jogo
Em SOBERANO, você precisa usar sua astúcia e correr riscos para demonstrar força, enquanto a guerra civil entre as duas famílias mais poderosas assola o reino. Para isso, você vai manipular a corte e recrutar aliados nas duas famílias, trazendo esses personagens para trabalhar para você. Mas, não se iluda, a lealdade deles é temporária. Basta você pedir um favor ou fazer uma intriga e eles irão considerar qualquer influência que você tinha sobre eles paga. Controlar a burguesia, o clero e a nobreza é o seu maior objetivo e você realiza isso através de intrigas. Se você conseguir fazer isso antes que as outras famílias percebam quem é a ameaça, o seu plano pode funcionar e a coroa terminar sob a sua cabeça.

SOBERANO é um jogo de cartas para 2 a 4 jogadores disputando o direito ao trono. É um construtor de baralho, desconstruído, já que as cartas que você recruta para o seu baralho são temporárias. É também uma corrida por cinco pontos de vitória, representados pelas castas da sociedade (Burgueses, Clero e Nobres) associados as duas famílias principais. Aquele que conseguir os cinco pontos, provou para o reino que tem o que é preciso para ser chamado o SOBERANO.    Não Avaliado
Componentes    Componentes

32 Cartas de Aliados (4 conjuntos de 8 cartas - 1 a 4 - vermelhos e azuis)
24 Cartas da Corte (5 a 10 - vermelhos e azuis, duas cartas de cada cor)
10 Cartas de Locais (Burgueses, Clero e Nobres - vermelhos e azuis, uma carta de cada cor | Vila Inicial - quatro cartas, uma para cada jogador)
12 Cartas Melhorias (Laços e Cargos)

Name: Mystery Wizard
Description:
On a hexed isle far across a shining sea, wizards duel for magical supremacy and the fate of the island itself.

Mystery Wizard is a game for 2 to 6 players that takes around an hour to play, starring 8 unique spellcasting characters, each providing a radically different strategic experience. When each player chooses a wizard, they are selecting a totally unique set of spells and abilities which will flavor their strategic choices and paths to victory.

Each wizard begins the game in their village, in a corner of the hexagonal board. In the center of the board is a tower filled with ancient secrets. The objective of the game is to loot the tower and return two of its Mysteries home to your village. However, Mysteries are scarce, and in order to secure your own, you’ll need to take them from someone else. Fierce opposition from rival wizards will take the form of fireballs, cyclones, wild animals, lightning bolts and more, leading to a chaotic capture-the-flag brawl where alliances can form or dissolve in the blink of an eye.

Players must also navigate the effects of villainous priests, friendly goblins, burning desert sands, civil war, and more. A dynamic and engaging quest system brings the hexed isle to life with events and monsters, and provides a way for wizards to earn enchanted gear and powerful spells by seeking out lost temples and buried treasure. However, a creeping madness threatens to corrupt the land if the wizards do not move fast enough. The tension and difficulty slowly increase throughout game and lead to an end game characterized by knife’s edge decision, where making one wrong move could spell doom.

—description from the publisher

Name: Wise Ask
Description:
Wise Ask - A Trivia Game Where It Pays To Be A Know-It-All.

If you get invited to one more run-of-the-mill trivia game night, your know-it-all mind is going to blow a neuron.  Let that brilliant brain of yours really shine when you play Wise Ask.

Rather than answering one measly little question to earn a point like some trivia games, Wise Ask makes you answer five successive multiple-choice questions in your head and then shout a five-letter word made from the letters associated with each correct answer.  Shout out the right word, get a smart card.  Get it wrong, lose one.  Be first to collect five cards that spell S-M-A-R-T and win!

—description from the publisher

Name: Cards & Punishment: Vol. 2 (fan expansion for Cards Against Humanity)
Description:
From publisher:
"*And yet another unofficial, unauthorized, 3rd party expansion pack for Cards Against Humanity

You must own Cards Against Humanity to use this expansion. It is not for use without original game.
    Professionally printed on casino-quality cards with a linen-finish.
    Includes 33 question cards and 77 white cards (one blank).
    Now in the correct size, for her pleasure! (Pleasure not guaranteed)

You didn't ask for it, so here it is! Volume 2 of Cards & Punishment is here like news that you're pregnant with twins: unwanted, more than you asked for, and just an additional expense. Please note, there have been a couple of required changes from the first printing of volume 1. Size issues have been fixed; you're welcome ladies. Card backs are still black and white with a minor formatting change. Card front colors are now Dark Blue Balls and Someone Else Peed the Bed Light Yellow."

Name: Merlin: Arthur Expansion
Description:
King Arthur has decided to join in the search to find a worthy successor to his throne. King Arthur will use his tactics to help knights gain more points and rewards throughout the game.

The Arthur expansion adds a brand new rondell that fits over the top of the Merlin base game rondell. King Arthur now has his very own internal track that only he can move round either clockwise or anti-clockwise.

This new expansion to the base game of Merlin opens up more action spaces and rewards as well as King Arthur himself. The expansion also adds new elements including the Picts and King Arthur's ring.

-description from publisher's Kickstarter campaign
Families: Theme: King Arthur / The Knights of the Round Table / Camelot

Name: One Session Gettysburg
Description:
A very compact and fast simulation of the Battle of Gettysburg playable in a single session, as an evolution of the Gettysburg game originally designed by Hampton Newsome as part of his Meade's Turn.

Units accumulate fatigue, losses and disorder like their real counterparts, and stop working long before they are eliminated by combat. Corps are activated by chitpulls and a simple order system (no writing) captures the delays inherent in 19th century campaigning and the unreliability of individual leaders.

Map scale: Half a mile per hex
Time scale: 3.5 hours per daylight turn (4 daylight, one night turn per day)
Unit scale: Divisions, individual army and corps commanders

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Operation Thunderclap: The Sixth Army's Last Chance
Description:
The Last Chance to Save an Army

Operation Thunderclap is a simulation of the attempted German breakout of the Sixth Army which was surrounded in Stalingrad during mid-December 1942. The Sixth Army, Hitler’s largest force, is sent to capture Stalingrad. However, Stalin had prepared an effective snare; Circle around the city and keep the Sixth Army penned inside until their supplies ran out. To make matters worse, the Sixth Army was further prevented from leaving by Hitler’s own order: Remain in Stalingrad and await rescue. 
 Each of the players assumes one of the sides in this fateful encounter. The German player must attempt to defeat the Russian armies and penetrate the area known as the Stalingrad Pocket. The Russian player’s task is simple; hold the pocket long enough to rout the Sixth Army.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Red Devils At Arnhem
Description:
Red Devils At Arnhem is a two player board-wargame recreating Operation Market-Garden. The plan as to capture a series of bridges with paratroopers and with Allied combined air and ground units break through the German lines during WWII and end the war by Christmas in 1944. Unexpected by the Allies was the presence of German SS forces at Arnhem. This spectacular plan is now in your hands and the possible the fate of the war.

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Let's Drink
Description:
The "Let's Drink" coffee shop opens today!! Let's visit the host bunny and drink together! There's always special milk foam and ingredients for each cup of drink. Which one you want? Let's drink it!

When a player reveals a card from the drink deck in Let's Drink, everyone needs to distinguish the correct drink. There are many combinations of cup, taste, milk foam, and tablecloth. If you find the right one, you can get the card. If there's no appropriate drink, just remind the host bunny! Don't be too late to remind her, or you'll get nothing!

Name: Blossoms: Night Iris Promo Card
Description:
Night Iris is a single-card micro expansion for Blossoms.

After the game setup, shuffle the night iris into the deck.

When you draw the night iris during the Growth action, you must immediately put it into a chosen pot with a flower, even one with a special action token.

If you draw the card using the Pruner action, add it to your hand – you can use it any turn you want.

Once you play the night iris, discard all cards in the pot, including the night iris.

Playing the card ends your turn.

Name: Stworze: Zakazana Polana
Description: The expansion "Forbidden Meadow" introduces new mechanics, e.g. Law Cards or new methods of finishing Missions. It also enables direct fights between Stworza and a new Stworze enters the fray: Drugost.

Name: Kharnage: Cthulhu
Description:
Cthulhu rises in the world of Kharnage! You have no more choice to be more powerful than him by destroying more units or by banishing him!

Cthulhu is an expansion for Kharnage, drawn by Goomi.

—description from the publisher

Game changes:
SET UP
Set a Horror pile with 3 Cultists cards, 1 card from the Shoggoth and 1 card from Cthulhu (except the head). Shuffle this pile and put it face down next to the Domination tokens.

END OF THE ROUND
During the Domination token distribution, the 4th player who destroyed the most cards draws 1 card from the Horror pile. If it is a Cultist or the Shoggoth card, deploy it in your Army (and immediately take the other parts of the Shoggoth if necessary). Otherwise, the Master of R’lyeh, Cthulhu himself, appears!

Set the 9 cards of Cthulhu between 2 players.

During each next End of the Round phases, before the Domination token distribution, Cthulhu attacks each player separately with all its Strength with its 3 Crushing skill symbols. During the Domination token distribution, Cthulhu is considered as a player.

The player who destroyed Cthulhu suffers the Cthulhu’s Revenge and keeps the 9 cards for the Domination token distribution.

The cards which are parts of Cthulhu are not casted face down on the Hill at the end of the End of the Round phases because Cthulhu cannot die, it is just banned. The player who destroyed it keep the Cthulhu’s Head with its 3 Domination points.

END OF THE GAME
Cthulhu may win the game.

Name: First Class: Module G – The Magician
Description:
At the last stop in Transylvania, a wizard entered the train. He titled himself a "Good One". But maybe he isn't this one?!?

While you take the wizard cards from First Class: Module G out of the display, you don't know which one you'll get. His tricks will bring you further and will be leave your opponents confused behind.

—description from publisher

•••

Beim letzten Halt in Transsilvanien ist ein Zauberer zugestiegen. Er hat sich als Gutfried vorgestellt. Aber ist er vielleicht eher ein Bösewicht?
Wenn du eine Zaubererkarten aus der Auslage wählst, weißt du noch nicht was dich erwartet. Die Tricks des Magiers werden dich vorwärts bringen, deine Mitspieler werden aber vielleicht etwas verwirrt zurück bleiben.

Name: Who Goes There: Blair and Clark Character Expansion Pack
Description:
Each character has their own unique abilities and specialty cards ready to help them.  With this character pack, Who Goes There can expand to accommodate 5-6 characters.  Characters are also interchangeable and can be swapped out to create different teams and add more variety to your game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Who Goes There: Van Wall and Norris Character Expansion Pack
Description: Each character has their own unique abilities and specialty cards ready to help them.  With this character pack, Who Goes There can expand to accommodate 5-6 characters.  Characters are also interchangeable and can be swapped out to create different teams and add more variety to your game.

Name: Organizer
Description:
Organizer is an auction-type card game that has players taking the role of trendy event organizers booking popular DJs for the world's best music festival, while avoiding the cops shutting down the show.

(Game Flow)
Each turn an artist will be put up for bid.
Players first gain funds and then bid for the booking.
Players try to collect artists with groove point sets.
The game ends when a player's festival has five acts.
The player with the most points wins.

Name: Wrestlenomicon
Description:
Fire Opal Games and Arc Dream Publishing bring you the grudge match to end them all: WRESTLENOMICON!

Become a Great Old One and slam, smash, and obliterate your opponent. Wrestlenomicon is a throw-down to the doom. This furious card game of squicky battles sets up in seconds and plays in minutes—or longer, if tactics are your thing. This is the definition of brainy beer-and-pretzels fun, with plenty of tentacles.

Each deck of cards represents a unique Great Old One. The core game includes a deck for CTHULHU—the Ageless Abomination! the South Seas Smasher!—and another for HASTUR, the insane and unspeakable force behind the King in Yellow. More Great Old Ones are coming.

Name: Abrana
Description:
Abrana is an two player abstract racing game. Each player will have one pawn and six markers. You start the game at the edge of the gameboard (a six by six grid) Each turn you will jump over empty spaces placing your markers OR over markers to turn them black OR  jump at a marker removing it from the grid OR if within reach jump at your opponent removing her from the game. Game ends as six markers of one color is placed OR if one player is removed.

Your objective is to get most markers of your own color onto the grid before the end of the game. The winner is the player with the most markers of its own color at the end of the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Gem Hustle
Description:
Fast and fun dice bluffing game

It's tough out here in the old west but your gang of outlaws recently “discovered” a stash of gemstones. Must be your lucky day. Now all you've got to do is divide it up. Of course you want the bigger half, but the desert is too unforgiving to risk a gun fight. So you play a game of chance. That doesn’t mean you’ll play fair though...

Gem Hustle is dice game for 2 to 5 players. Roll the highest each round to claim gems, but you can only roll each dice once. With only a few high value dice, do you chance it on your own or team up with others but share the spoils?

Rounds are played until players have used all their dice or until there are no more gems left to be won. In a round players will;


     Stash - players take it in turns to add gems to the grey bag.
     Pick - players choose which dice they are going to roll.
     Hustle - players can chose to team up with other players and share the stash.
     Roll - players roll their dice. The players with the highest total claim the stash.


—description from the designer

Name: 40th Panzer Korps: Russia, October 1941
Description:
40th Panzer Korps is a company/battalion level simulation of the battles in the vicinity of the old Napoleonic battle ground of Borodino just west of Mozhaysk. The players control the 40th Panzer Korps and elements of the Soviet’s 5th Army. The game uses the 48th Panzer Korps system, which emphasizes the special abilities of the various arms, armour, infantry and artillery.  The German player must use his powerful forces to open the road to Moscow and victory.

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Peter Lugenschüppel
Description:
The players start with one pawn on space 1. Movement is determined with one die. The first player to reach space 90 wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

Some events cause the player to start with a secondary pawn to rescue the primary one, which has to stay on it's space till the secondary pawn arrives. If this is achieved the primary pawn moves again and the secondary one waits on this space till it may be needed again. To win the game only the primary pawn needs to reach space 90.

—user summary

Name: Ramasjang: Mysteriet
Description:
Board game version of the popular Danish TV children show "Ramasjang Mysteriet" where kids help Kristian solve crimes comitted by one of the usual suspects.

Help each other find out which of the 7 well known Ramasjang bad guys is guilty by finding evidence and investigate leads. As the game progress, try to guess who committed the crime. The winner is the who has accumulated most liquorice pipe (Danish candy) points at the end of the game.

—user summary

Name: Folytassa őrmester úr!
Description:
"Keep On Mr. Sergeant"

Service message:
Dear adults and kids,

This is an exciting game resulting many cheerful moments and much more mind-breaking minutes. First of all you will need some ingenuity and combination skills to be able to win.

The venue of the game is an imagined army base where several comic situations may occur. They are governed by 203 coloured cards decorated with artistic graphics. One of he aims of the game is to acquire the Secret Plan and forward it to the sergeant by the most creative way. Meanwhile we should be careful not to be seized to prison (however the prison works with half board service) or not to blurt any secrets in the pub in delirious state. We should decide tactically during our turn of duty whether we take risk or just take part in the barrack contest of „who knows better the canteen-keeper's woman.

But the surprise of the game is still left: the evolvement of  ’ant’, ’chameleon’, and ’hyena’… Those have the best chance to win who can conform to the constantly changing situation rather than choosing a permanent strategy. Any lags can be caught up with clever decisions. This is a real brain training. You can have several hours amusement by learning the duty service regulations.
Wish you many clever decisions, good luck and lots of fun,
                                the happy Sergeant

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Baltrum
Description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.

Name: Székely Gazdálkodó
Description:
It is not the richest family, but you have to live something, so you want to manage it. To start your business, you have to have some animals, so you can compete with larger businesses.
The Székely Gazdálkodó tries to put you into situations that characterize the everyday life of the Székely people. Of course, there are some funny scenes that are just for fun. In Székely Gazdálkodó's board game, you can feel like a real host who is a master of your own farm and strives to get out of the ordinary people. We wish a good farming!

Name: Christmas Tree: Essen Special Cards
Description:
Christmas Tree: Essen Special Cards is a mini-expansion for Christmas Tree that consists of two extra objective cards.

Usable: With the normal and advanced game.
Objective: 6 points for each formation containing 3 ornaments: 2 glass ornaments with the same color and shape on both sides of a gingerbread/wrapped candy.
Setup: Shuffle the 2 Special cards into the deck.

During the game: At the beginning of the round, after  the ornament cards are dealt, if you have a Special card in your hand, put it face up into the middle of the table and draw a new ornament card from the remaining deck. After you have chosen your objective cards as usual, place them from the Special card(s) separately (in the advanced game, after the objectives went around.).

The Special cards are objective cards, but not in a standard way. During the evaluation of the objectives at the end of the round, you can choose one (or two) Special card(s) from the table (if there is any), instead of one (or two) original objective card(s). You will evaluate the chosen Special card(s), instead of the chosen original card(s) (but the other players still can use the original objectives).

This way you will score the same number of objectives as usual, but you will have the option to choose a Special objective card - which maybe better fits your christmas tree - instead of one of the original objectives.

Name: Kero: The Boss Variant
Description:
Apply the boss sticker at the back of both their respective tokens (1 for each clan).

Those tokens now play like any other explorer tokens but have an ability that can be triggered once per game:
 In case of a tie, the boss power can be activated to win the territory on which it is located. If both bosses are activated on the same card, no one wins.

Promo found in Plato Magazine 109.

Name: Nothing Personal: Justino "The Player" Gotlibi Promo Card
Description:
A special Gangster card from Just Got Played‘s Promo card giveaway.

“When Justino is drawn and placed, immediately swap him with the Capo (influence tokens remain on the Capo).”

Name: Affinity: Goodies 7/7 Special Plato
Description:
Three additional Emotion cards.

Simply shuffle these new cards to their respective decks.
Usual rules apply.

Promo found in Plato magazine 109.

Name: Penciltown
Description:
Penciltown is a solitaire town-building strategy game with heavy random elements. It's print-and-play, and uses a pencil, an eraser and two d6s.

It's played entirely on a mostly-blank sheet of paper: you draw the town yourself. The writing is thematically dense, and is more or less low fantasy.

Each round, you roll to see how productive your town is. You then get to forage for additional resources, spend accumulated resources to improve your town, or mount a quest. You also roll to see whether an event occurs each round. Events are interactive, and can involve a decision. Many of them also include an attack on your town, which you need to prepare for adequately or suffer the consequences.

The goal of the game is to make it to the final round without your town being destroyed, while also fulfilling the objective you rolled at the start of the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Fix och Foxi på äventyr i skogen
Description: You have two playing pieces who you want to move as fast you can thru the forest. It is always the playing piece that is furthest away from goal that have to move every time. At 10 spaces it will happen special things in the forest. The player that lands on these spaces have to roll a color-dice with only red and green fields and do the outcome of the die.

Name: Äppel-päppel
Description:
You walking along a fruit-path and the first one reaching the fruit-basket wins.

There is seven spots on the board where tiles with the path fruit are placed face down except for one who is face up.
On your turn you throw the color-die and move to the closest space with that color. The player have then to reveal the fruit that is on the space they moved to, to stay there. If the player fail to reveal correct fruit they have to move backwards to the closets space with the fruit they revealed.

Name: Snövit och de sju dvärgarna
Description:
The wicked queen is back! Now she has taken away Snow White and holds her captive at the castle. You and your fellow players are the seven dwarfs, and now you have to leave the mine on a dangerous trip through the woods and into the castle's dark halls to free Snow White. Whoever can find Snow White has won the game!

An easy dice game where you move and do what the place you go to shows. In the castle you go to different rooms and look for Snow White. This is done by lifting a card. The one who finds Snow White first wins.

—user summary

Name: Roll Player: Lockup Pack
Description:
A set of 6 cards originally available during the Kickstarter campaign for Lockup: A Roll Player Tale. They had a pledge level just for these cards.

Cards include:
Weapon Card: Ancestral Blade 
Scroll Card: Transmute* 
Minion Card: Insectoid* 
Minion Card: Ratman* 
Minion Card: Nightmare* 
Minion Card: Flayer*


    Requires the Roll Player: Monsters & Minions Expansion.

Name: Dinosaurs Get Stress, Too!
Description:
This is a therapeutic educational game designed to help children cope with stressful situations.

Players roll dice and consult a Symptoms Chart with a whimsical cartoon illustration of a stressed-out dinosaur. The active player chooses a Control Card or a Relaxation Card in response. If the text on the card increases that player's anxiety he or she must take a Stress Rock chip. A player stuck with a Victim Card gets hit on the head with a foam rock. The player then describes how he or she will deal with this stressful event.

EXAMPLE: The child is stressed "when his Dad hogs the TV."

The object of the game is to get rid of all Stress Rocks in a player's possession.

Designed for kids age six and older to play with a parent, teacher, or therapist.

Includes charts, cards, dice, chips, rules, and a large chunk of foam granite.

—user summary

Name: Horizon Zero Dawn: The Board Game – The Heart of the Nora
Description:
The Heart of the Nora is an alternate play mode expansion, allowing players to enjoy the game as some of their favourite characters from Horizon Zero Dawn and replay this iconic quest from the videogame. This expansion features the ancient war machines from the time of the old ones - a Deathbringer, and two Corruptors, as well as reference and behaviour cards for these powerful enemies. It also features additional tiles and a deck to allow players to replay the quest, replacing the tracking cards found in the main game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Of Dreams & Shadows: Riding Horse Promo Card
Description:
This is a promo card for Of Dreams & Shadows.

"Riding Horse" is a new resource card that you add to the resource deck at the beginning of the game.

It is a "Companion," with a cost of 1, and the following ability: "Gain an extra Move action during the Action phase."

It was released in Game Trade Magazine #224 (October 2018).

Name: Tower of Madness: Dr. Jin Wu Promo Card
Description:
This is a promo card for Tower of Madness.

"Dr. Jin Wu" is a new investigator card, allowing players an extra investigator to choose from at the beginning of the game.

Her ability is: "Jin counts each Madness marble as 5 points toward her victory, until she goes Insane."

This promo card was distributed in Game Trade Magazine #224 (October 2018).

Name: Fall's Leaves Fall
Description:
Fall's Leaves Fall is a roll and write game about us as drafts that help Autumn leaves fall to the ground from a tree.

Pretty simple, right?

Well, the are 2 small restrictions for movement and in your way down you get to take victory points from other leaves you meet, dandelions and get bonuses from various sources, plus in your personal board you can have a set collection bonus plus a bonus if you reach down first!

All you need is to print the main board, the player board and the rules, get six dice and as many colored pencils as the number of players and start rolling and falling !!!

—description from the designer

Name: A Pleasant Journey to Neko: Penguin Habitat 1
Description:
This promo card "Penguin Habitat" is for Essen Spiel'18.

When use the advanced setup of this game, add this card to other advanced cards. Shuffle all the advanced card and draw three of them without looking the front and put those cards on designated space in main board.

Penguin Habitat: When the game ends, each special stop gives you 3 points including this card.

-description from designer

Name: A Pleasant Journey to Neko: Whale Watching Mini-Expansion
Description:
The mini-expansion included 4 cards (plus a 5th card that contains a summary of the rules). Two of them used for 1st period and the remaining two used for 2nd period.

Setup

When setting up the game, reveal two 1st period Whale Watching cards and display them next to main board. When the next period begins, reveal two 2nd period Whale Watching cards and display them next to main board.

Bidding

You can bid for those cards during Action Phase as well. Unlike other cards, the rules for resolving Whale Watching are changed as follow:

You still use dice to bid Whale Watching and the basic rule of bidding remains unchanged, but this time when you resolve the card, ignore the number of a dice. The more dice you use to bid the card than other player, you win the bid. If there is a tie, the player who has prior turn order wins the bid.

Effect

Whenever a ship passes through Whale Watching, you get the items that are shown on the card immediately.

Note: If you add advance cards in a game, you should resolve the card in bidding area and then resolve the advance card in order if any players bid them. Whale Watching will resolve in order very last.

-description from designer

Name: Keyflower: Developer
Description:
Keyflower: Developer is a new village tile for the game Keyflower. The rules for the Developer tile are as follows:

The owner of the developer scores 2 points (or 3 points if the tile has been upgraded) for each upgrade icon that is on an adjacent tile.

—description from the publisher

Name: tumult
Description:
Tumult is a checkers variant where both players jump over the tokens of the opponent to remove them from the board.
The player with the most remaining tokens on the board wins.

This is a travel game version.

Name: quintro
Description:
Quintro is a simple game similar to Tic-Tac-Toe. Only instead of three in a row, the winner must connect five in a row.

This is part of a travel game edition from Spear.

Name: mini-go
Description:
mini-go is a checkers variant where both players try to enclose the opponent's tokens in order to remove them from the board.
The player which only has three tokens left looses the game.

This is part of a travel game edition from Spear.

Name: bastion
Description:
bastion is a checkers variant. The player with the white tokens tries to reach all red places or to enclose the black tokens of the other player. The player with the black tokens tries to remove at least 16 white tokens from the board by jumping over them. 
The winner is the player who reaches his goal first.

This game is part of a travel game edition from Spear.

Name: wirrwarr
Description: wirrwarr is a one person logic game. The player tries to arrange all the tokens in a specific order by moving to adjacent files in a minimum number of turns

Name: Urbi et Orbi Game 2000
Description: Players are travelling to Rome. On their way, they answer several questions about ancient Rome.

Name: Lach mal wieder
Description: Funny question and answer game. Each player has his own cards and reads a question to the next player who answers with the answer on his card.

Name: Fußball: Das Kartenspiel
Description:
A card game about soccer
The starting player play a card and the next players try to find a next logical move by playing a new card. The winner is the player who managed to get rid off his cards before the others do so.

Name: Arschkeks: Wirst du es packen oder verkacken?
Description:
Party Game.
85 challenge and special cards, 1 die, 1 Arschkeks (Ass Cookie).
The player who has the "Arschkeks" is the active player. He draws a card and tries to do the challenge. If he is successful he gets the points which are written on the card. After his challenge he selects the next player.
If the player does not succeed he gets a punishment.
Examples for challenges:

     Call your the other players "Arschkeks" for 5 minutes.
     Hold your chair with your outstretched arm for 30 seconds.


Example for Punishments:

     Jump 1 minute on the place and say with each jump idiot
     10 knee bends


Special cards: suspend (stay in pushup positon till the next player has done his challenge), take 2 cards (draw 2 and do both), creativ card (make your own challenge for 1-3 players), joker (you may ignore 1 punishment, if you don't want to do a challenge)

Name: 勇者アーキテクト (Brave Architect)
Five in a Row
Description:
This game is played with a large spinning circle (dial) that is divided into four colors (red, yellow, blue, green).  Each section has holes for 5 colored pegs as the same color as the quarter section.  Each player decides which color they want to play and then takes the 5 pegs of their color.  Each player, in turn, spins the dial.  There is an arrow in the corner of the box.  Whichever color the arrow is pointing at when the dial stops, the player of that color gets to put one of their pegs in one of the holes of that color, regardless of which player spun the dial.
Winner is the first person who has succeeded in getting all 5 of their pegs into their colored area.

Name: Road Closed
Description:
Build Roads - Connect Cities - Sabotage Friends

Better be quick and smart - the newly minted transportation commissioner has approached your company to devise a road network to connect all the cities; however the commissioner has also contacted your biggest rivals too. Who is going to win the contract? It’s anyone’s game and you’ll stop at nothing to get the job done – even if it takes sabotage. But your rivals feel the same…

Draw your tiles and place them efficiently to connect all your cities while avoiding sabotage from your opponent's road closures. Be the first to successfully connect all your cities to at least two other cities and you will win the contract (and the game).

—description from the designer

Name: Million Mile Flyer
Description:
Criss-cross the USA in a race to obtain a million miles!

Fasten your seatbelt and prepare for takeoff, as you are about to embark on a sprint to a million miles! The skies ahead are turbulent and unpredictable. Bad weather, traffic delays and disgruntled passengers will all conspire against you as you and your fellow competitors criss-cross the country in a race to determine who will be crowned the Million Mile Flyer.

Along the way you will have the opportunity to impede your opponents progress, but keep in mind what ever misfortune you visit on others will likely be returned. But that's all part of the fun. The game is unpredictable and your circumstances can literally change in the blink of an eye.

Frequent travelers will find themselves reliving their own air travel nightmares in a humorous setting while kids will love the nonstop, action packed race to the finish line.

—descriptoion from the designer

Name: Brewitched
Description:
Sit down and grab a glass because here comes a story...

You've plundered the dungeon and come away with a solid and heavy treasure chest. After struggling to break the lock, to everyone's surprise, the chest was full of...potions! In Brewitched, you are adventurers sharing and tasting unknown potions to discover which ones are the most powerful (and valuable).

Spend your action points to smell, switch, drink, and throw away a potion or use one of the eight characters' special abilities. But be careful! Some of the potions are cursed, and this curse will be represented in real life... The results will be hilarious!

A DRINKING GAME (OR NOT)
Fun with or without drinks!
Play with younger players or designated drivers.

Name: Museum Rush: The Annex
Description:
The Annex expansion allows thieves to play with more friends. The game, made for 2-4, is now expanded up to 6 players.

This expansion includes:

     9 new room tiles
     2 new thieves
     2 new treasures 
     10 additional search deck cards

Name: Mine Carts
Description:
Mine Carts is a game in which the players together explore an abandoned mine, looking for precious ores!

The abandoned mine is represented by a six by six grid on a board. The players start with two player figures each at the edges and take turns placing square tiles with tracks leading into the mine. They follow the tracks and may stumble upon ore deposits when doing so. Mining an ore deposit yields an ore token that may be more or less valuable.

Throughout the game, players will find themselves colliding with other players. Players that collide will loose their player figures and will, when no player figures remain, be eliminated from the game. However, eliminated players haven't automatically lost the game. They may still win, granted that they managed to collect the most precious ores before being eliminated!

Clever players may find ways to mine the ore deposits while also eliminating other players!

—description from the designer

Name: Montana: Trade Post
Description:
A mini-expansion for Montana released at Essen 2018.

Replace one of each player's settlement with a trade post during the setup.
During the game each player can build his settlement by paying its cost with money instead of goods.

-description from publisher

Name: 花と吹雪 (Bloom in Blizzard)
Description:
Once upon a time, there’s was kingdom nobody knows. Everybody wanted to marry the young, wise, beautiful princess, even though they knew she could be troublesome sometimes. One day the princess said “The man who brings me a handful of these flowers will be my husband”. The “task” the princess proposed wasn’t easy at all for the flower she named was “Gem Flower” which can only be raised in dead-cold weather. Now the battle of suitors has begun.

You’re one of the suitors who gained relative’s support to acquire “Gem Flower”. You are in the coldest county of the nation where you can find “Gem Seeds”. Whoever gathered enough seeds to obtain 2 Flowers(20 Seeds) is the winner.

Players put one of the cards they have face down to determine “Sunity”(The higher the number, the more sun you see) each round. There are numbers from 1 to 50. The “Sunity” will determine which regions will be hit by blizzards. One of the numbers played this round will become current “Sunity”.
Once all players played their cards, each player guess current “Sunity” and move one of their player tokens to a region on the game board.

The numbers (10~40) shown on the game board is the required Sunity in order to receive reward from that particular region. The regions with the numbers less than equal to Sunity will be hit by a blizzard.  When everyone moved their player tokens, turn all the played cards face up and determine Sunity.

All the player tokens that were hit by blizzards will be removed from the game board and sent back to their hometowns. Players will receive rewards from each player tokens remained on the game board. The number +1~+4 shows how many seeds you can receive from each region.

Avoid blizzards by figuring out Sunity and become the first one to acquire Gem Flower!

Name: Interference!
Description:
Interference! is a game in which two players attempt to save the world from utter destruction.

You are the operators of a missile control mainframe and due to a slight human error, the total annihilation of the world is looming! The systems have locked you out and you can only rely on your hacking skills to regain control.

The mainframe's lock is represented by four double-sided cards that are shared between the two players. Both players hold a hand of secret action cards as well as a card showing a secret target sequence.

Using their action cards, the players struggle to change the lock sequence into their target sequence. This will break a layer of the mainframe's security system and help the players regain control.

Will the two players prevail and save the world or should we all seek immediate shelter? The fate of the world is in your hands!

—description from the designer

Name: 7 for the Queen
Description:
In 7 for the Queen, players compete to create a new necklace for the Queen, but it is not easy to meet her ever-changing needs and desires, and they have to ensure they have the right combination when the Queen finally decides what she wants.

7 for the Queen won the annual "Best Unpublished Game" competition sponsored by dV Giochi and Lucca Comics and Games, and this limited edition of the game is part of the reward.

Name: Prima Materia
Description:
The elements have become misaligned and are causing all sorts of trouble in the world. Severe drought, hurricane after hurricane and yet another super hero movie that no one asked for are just some of the plagues the world has had to live through. In Prima Materia, the players struggle to align the elements in an effort to make all things good again.

The elements are represented by sixteen double-sided cards showing one of the four classical elements on each side. These cards are arranged in a grid of four by four cards. Each player holds a secret hand of action cards as well as a card with a secret target sequence. The players use their action cards to change the elemental cards and gain points for each sequence they manage to form.

Will the elements realign and introduce stability in the world? Or will we face a future of starvation, war and reggaeton music?

—description from the designer

Name: Home Delivery
Description:
Why go to the same boring job every day in order to receive a steady and predictable income when you can start working in the gig economy? The gig economy allows you to get all of the drawbacks and none of the benefits while struggling to make ends meet.

In Home Delivery, the players take on work as traveling popsicle sellers. The players take turns placing rectangular city tiles forming the road network of the city. In some parts of the city, there lives popsicle-craving residents with very specific tastes. They will gladly purchase a popsicle but it will have to be of the correct flavor.

Each player can take on tasks from the local ice cream parlors, delivering a set of popsicles to the residents. For every task that a player completes, they are awarded with a small paycheck. The players may save their paychecks to pay for things like rent and food or may use their pay to gain a competitive advantage over their fellow popsicle sellers.

Have you ever dreamt of owning your very own ice cream truck? Well forget about that. You're part of generation rent and this is the gig economy so all you can afford is to rent one and hope that your investment pays off!

So what are you waiting for? Quit your day job and become part of the new economy. It's gonna be huge.

—description from the designer
